title: How to Create a Text Input Using HTML

steps.headline: Create an HTML page.
steps.description: To do that, open up Notepad or any other plain text editor. On Windows, you can access Notepad via the Start Menu, at: "Accessories", then "Notepad". Or, use the Windows key + R, then type notepad and press enter.

steps.headline: Put in the code.
steps.description: Write the normal tags (<html><head></head><body></body></html>), and it should look like:

steps.headline: Now that you have the base code, you're ready to make a form to hold the text box and then make the text box.
Save the page.
steps.description: Click "File", "Save As", and then save it as test.html. Or, save it as anything.html.

steps.headline: Open up the window and see your new text box!
steps.description: Using JavaScript, now you could make the text box do something in conjunction with a button! If you want to put some text before the input box to explain what it is, do so before the <input> tag.

text:
Create an HTML page. To do that, open up Notepad or any other plain text editor. On Windows, you can access Notepad via the Start Menu, at: "Accessories", then "Notepad". Or, use the Windows key + R, then type notepad and press enter. Put in the code. Write the normal tags (), and it should look like: Now that you have the base code, you're ready to make a form to hold the text box and then make the text box. Between the two body tags, ( and ), type:

"} Save the page. Click "File", "Save As", and then save it as test.html. Or, save it as anything.html. Open up the window and see your new text box! Using JavaScript, now you could make the text box do something in conjunction with a button! If you want to put some text before the input box to explain what it is, do so before the tag.
sentences: To do that, open up Notepad or any other plain text editor.
On Windows, you can access Notepad via the Start Menu, at: "Accessories", then "Notepad".
Or, use the Windows key + R, then type notepad and press enter.
Write the normal tags (<html><head></head><body></body></html>), and it should look like: Now that you have the base code, you're ready to make a form to hold the text box and then make the text box.
Between the two body tags, (<body> and </body>), type: <form name="test">.

\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Save the page.
Click "File", "Save As", and then save it as test.html.
Open up the window and see your new text box!
Using JavaScript, now you could make the text box do something in conjunction with a button!
If you want to put some text before the input box to explain what it is, do so before the <input> tag.
